intro: Centaurea boissieri var. atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic centaury, is a flowering plant native to the western Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and blue to violet flowers. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bristly seed heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
